entries.title: Alec Baldwin and weapons specialist formally charged with 'involuntary manslaughter' in 'Rust' set shooting
entries.description: Cinematographer Halyna Hutchins died shortly after being wounded during rehearsals at a ranch near Santa Fe, New Mexico, in October 2021.

entries.title: US charges four more men in the assassination of Haitian president Jovenel Moïse
entries.description: The US Justice Department announced that four men were transferred from Haiti Tuesday to face criminal charges. They will appear in federal court in Miami on Wednesday.

entries.title: What's in the draft bill to accelerate renewable energy in France
entries.description: Despite certain improvements, the text adopted by the Assemblée Nationale is not enough of a push toward the green transition, according to environmental activists.

entries.title: Series break: The Shtisel family is off to Istanbul
entries.description: The Israeli series set in an ultra-Orthodox neighborhood of Jerusalem will be remade in Turkey, featuring a fundamentalist Muslim community.

entries.title: Iran jails young couple filmed dancing in Tehran
entries.description: The young couple was convicted of 'encouraging corruption and public prostitution' after the video of their dance at a landmark tower went viral.

entries.title: In DRC, Pope Francis condemns Africa's 'economic colonialism'
entries.description: The 86-year-old Francis is the first pontiff to visit Congo since John Paul II in 1985, when it was still known as Zaire. About half of Congo's population are Roman Catholics.

entries.title: EU votes to lift immunity for two lawmakers in 'Qatargate' corruption scandal
entries.description: Belgian lawmaker Marc Tarabella and Italian Andrea Cozzolino now face questioning by Belgian prosecutors.

entries.title: Remembering the punk poetry of Tom Verlaine, New York's Rimbaldian hero
entries.description: The American singer and guitarist, who led the band Television and loved French poetry, died at age 73.

entries.title: US Representative Santos steps down from House panels amid ethics issues
entries.description: The 34-year-old Republican has faced growing calls to resign after he admitted fabricating parts of his resume and biography since his election in New York last year.

entries.title: France and Australia seek to overcome Aukus crisis
entries.description: Australian foreign and defense ministers visited Paris with the aim of 'rebuilding the relationship' between Paris and Canberra and pledged to deliver shells to Ukraine.

entries.title: France commits to sending more Caesar self-propelled howitzers to Ukraine
entries.description: France and Australia on Monday agreed to jointly supply Ukraine with 155 mm shells needed for artillery provided by the West since Russia's invasion.

entries.title: Blinken expresses sorrow for 'innocent' Palestinians killed after meeting with Abbas
entries.description: The US secretary of state issued renewed appeals for Israeli-Palestinian calm amid an alarming spike in violence.

entries.title: Ultra-low turnout in Tunisia's parliamentary elections deepens the political crisis
entries.description: Only 11% of voters in Tunisia cast their ballot in the Sunday elections, with parliament holding little sway due to Kais Saied's all-powerful presidency.

entries.title: Taxing the world's richest would combat both climate change and poverty
entries.description: According to a study by the World Inequality Lab, the richest 1% of the world's population generates more carbon emissions than its poorest 50%.

entries.title: Chicago prosecutor drops R. Kelly sex-abuse charges
entries.description: The musician is already facing decades in prison for previous convictions, prompting the Cook County state’s attorney to stop her case.

entries.title: 'PSG is a team that no reshuffle has managed to transform'
entries.description: Following a good start of the season the team is once again sliding back into its old and predictable woes, columnist Jérôme Latta argues.

entries.title: 'Democracy in the DRC owes a lot to the Church'
entries.description: As Pope Francis visits the Democratic Republic of the Congo this week, Jason Stearns of the Congo Study Group describes the central role played by the Church in the country, including in the political sphere.

entries.title: Pension reform strikes: Round two of protests kick off across France
entries.description: From tiny islands to major cities, demonstrators poured into France's streets Tuesday in the latest clash of wills with the government over its plans to push back the retirement age.

entries.title: Bond actress Eva Green blames her 'Frenchness' for insulting director
entries.description: The actress told the high court that the fatal shooting on Alec Baldwin film set showed what could happen when 'corners are cut.'

entries.title: Pakistan suicide bombing indicates 'security lapses' in government compound
entries.description: The mosque is within a high-security zone and an investigation is under way into how the bomber got in.

entries.title: Eurozone dodges recession with weak fourth-quarter growth
entries.description: The latest data will be welcome after fears of a deep recession following Russia's war in Ukraine.

entries.title: Pension reform protests: Map of the January 31 demonstrations across France
entries.description: All day, we are updating this map with the number of demonstrators across the country.

entries.title: French pension reform: Government, Parliament and the streets engage in uncertain confrontation
entries.description: Trade unions called for another round of massive nationwide strikes and protests against the pension reform on Tuesday, in the hope of crushing the bill as it is debated in the Assemblée Nationale.

entries.title: Pension reform: The French town halls on strike to support demonstrators
entries.description: Several town halls, mostly left-wing, support the strikes that are taking place this Tuesday, January 31. The government has denounced theses moves as inappropriate.

entries.title: Junji Ito, manga artist of compelling horror
entries.description: The International Comics Festival in Angoulême, France, paid tribute to the undisputed master of Japanese horror.

entries.title: 2022 French economic growth: Companies held up well, but inflation affected households
entries.description: After minimal growth of 0.1% in the fourth quarter, GDP grew 2.6% last year, slowing sharply from 2021.

entries.title: Burkina Faso attack kills 13, mostly military, says army
entries.description: Ten military police officers, two of whom were members of an auxiliary force supporting the army, died in a 'terrorist attack' on Monday.

entries.title: French football governance: Provisional audit report harshly criticizes entire Federation
entries.description: According to the provisional audit report commissioned by the Sports Ministry and seen by 'Le Monde', the FFF's suspended president Noël Le Graët 'no longer has the necessary legitimacy to administer and represent French football.'

entries.title: IMF slightly less pessimistic for world growth than last fall
entries.description: The International Monetary Fund now expects global GDP to grow by 2.9% in 2023. While this is a slowdown from 2022, it's an improvement on estimates in October.

entries.title: French opposition parties call for Parliament debate on Ukraine arms shipment
entries.description: French political parties from the left and the right don't want the government to be deciding alone on sending arms to Ukraine. They want a vote in Parliament.

entries.title: Boeing rolls out last 747 after more than five-decade reign
entries.description: The last commercial Boeing 'jumbo' will be delivered to Atlas Air in a surviving freighter version on Tuesday, January 31.

entries.title: Norway's sovereign wealth fund says it lost $164 billion in 2022
entries.description: The world's largest sovereign wealth fund said the loss was due to knock-on effects from Russia's invasion of Ukraine and high inflation.

entries.title: In Israel, Netanyahu tries to reassure his American ally
entries.description: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken visited Jerusalem as a wave of repression and violence escalated in the city and in the West Bank.

entries.title: Pope Francis visits two struggling African nations, as 'pilgrim of peace' with limited impact
entries.description: In the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) and South Sudan, the Pope is hoping to work toward stability.

entries.title: French economy grew 2.6% in 2022, avoiding Q4 contraction
entries.description: In the fourth quarter, growth slowed down to only 0.1%. French consumer prices were back on the rise, with annual inflation accelerating to 6% from 5.9% in December.

entries.title: War in Ukraine: Biden refuses to send F-16 fighter jets as allies mull new arms deliveries
entries.description: Even though US President Joe Biden spoke against sending fighter jets to Ukraine, European leaders including French President Emmanuel Macron and Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte said the door was not closed.

entries.title: Pension reform: France braces for strikes on second day of national protests
entries.description: Transports and schools will come to standstill as strikers walk out in protest against the government's plan to raise the retirement age from 62 to 64.

entries.title: The Democratic Republic of Congo, a helpless giant against Rwandan interference
entries.description: The central African country is unable to control the mineral-rich regions on its eastern flank. Its Rwandan neighbor is largely instrumentalizing that instability with relative impunity.

entries.title: 'Bad for the environment, but good for jobs': A proposed coal mine divides northern English town
entries.description: In Whitehaven, England, the potential digging of an underground mine raises both the hopes of residents in search of jobs and the anger of environmental protection organizations.

entries.title: Is Africa the future of Catholicism (and will the next Pope be African)?
entries.description: Pope Francis will visit the Democratic Republic of Congo and South Sudan from January 31 to February 5 in his third visit to Sub-Saharan Africa.

entries.title: Pension reform: French government sees task complicated by hesitant lawmakers
entries.description: Some members of the majority are getting cold feet about certain measures in the bill. Meanwhile, the agreement with conservative MPs is looking more fragile than first thought.

entries.title: Death of Tyre Nichols: 2 more Memphis officers disciplined, EMTs fired
entries.description: Fallout from the deadly police beating of Black motorist Tyre Nichols now includes the firing of three Memphis Fire Department personnel and an announcement that a total of seven police officers were removed from their duties.

entries.title: Saudi Arabia, a promised paradise turned into a nightmare for Ugandan maids
entries.description: Kampala has suspended the bilateral agreement with Riyadh on migrant workers in response to the widespread abuse of female employees in the kingdom.

entries.title: Brazilian ex-president seeks visa to extend US stay amid legal threats at home
entries.description: Jair Bolsonaro filed on Monday, January 30, a request for a six-month visitor visa to remain in the United States. The far-right politician faces investigation in Brazil after supporters stormed government buildings on January 8 in an assault reminiscent of the January 6 attack on the US Capitol.

entries.title: 'Rabbit meat consumption has been steadily declining'
entries.description: The French rabbit industry – which has been in decline for several years – is trying to boost its sales while paying attention to the public discourse on animal welfare, explains 'Le Monde' journalist Laurence Girard.
